SUMMARY: Allocates $100,000 each fiscal year for road maintenance, focusing on high-traffic areas.
Replacement of aging patrol cruisers to ensure reliable, safe response vehicles for emergency and patrol duties.
Replacement of self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA) for firefighter safety in hazardous environments.
Upgrades for town servers, workstations, and networking hardware to ensure efficient operations and security.
Assessment of 150 culverts and 12 bridges for prioritizing replacements.
Replacement of 27-year-old brush mower to manage overgrown areas and enhance safety.
Purchase a brine applicator to reduce road salt usage and minimize environmental impact.
Replace 2007 Ford F250 used for operations, plowing, and daily activities.
Conceptual design phase for improving road conditions, drainage, and pedestrian safety on Brigham Street.
Replace outdated hydraulic extrication tools with modern battery-powered versions.
Install a water storage tank to improve water accessibility and safety for the school.
